title: Liverpool news: Joel Matip injury to see defender sidelined for six weeks
text:
Joel Matip is going to be out for the foreseeable future (Picture: Getty Images)

Joel Matip’s knee injury is going to keep him out of action for Liverpool for much longer than first expected, with the defender likely to miss the next six weeks.

The 28-year-old was thought to have a very minor injury, picking up a knock in the victory over Sheffield United on 28 September.

He sat out the following two fixtures, returning to the side for the 1-1 draw with Manchester United at Old Trafford, but this made the problem worse.

The Cameroon international has not been picked since the trip to Manchester, and the Evening Standard reports that the injury will see him miss a further six weeks for the European Champions.

Ahead of the Champions League win over Genk last week, Reds boss Jurgen Klopp said of Matip’s injury: ‘It is just a little thing which usually settles in the two weeks.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘It did [settle], but then it came up after the United game and so now we just have to make sure this time it settles finally, that’s all.

‘It is not a massive injury, it’s just a bit annoying for him and he cannot [face Genk].’

If Matip does indeed sit out for six weeks, that will be at least eight games he will miss, including Premier League contests against Aston Villa, Manchester City, Crystal Palace, Brighton and Everton.

The centre-back will also sit out crucial Champions League fixtures at Anfield against Genk and Napoli.

Dejan Lovren has partnered Virgil van Dijk in the centre of defence in Liverpool’s last two games, but Joe Gomez will also be pushing to take Matip’s slot, having also recovered full fitness.

‘Joe is completely back,’ Klopp told Sky Sports. ‘He knows that, it’s just how it is sometimes. He was not in his 100 per cent best shape. Now he’s back.’

Liverpool are in action on Wednesday at home to Arsenal in the League Cup, before a trip to Aston Villa in the Premier League on Saturday.
